meanings.definition: The act of printing or reproducing something again.
meanings.sent1: The teacher made several reimpressions of the worksheet for the students who lost theirs.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to create new reimpressions of their popular product to meet the high demand.
meanings.sent3: After the printer malfunctioned, it kept making reimpressions of the same page over and over.
meanings.sent4: Her memory was like a broken printer, constantly producing reimpressions of the same events.
meanings.sent5: The artist's studio was filled with reimpressions of his famous painting, each one slightly different.

meanings.definition: A new edition or printing of a book or other publication.
meanings.sent1: The bookstore received the latest reimpressions of the bestselling novel.
meanings.sent2: The library added the reimpressions of the classic book to its collection.
meanings.sent3: The author was excited to see the reimpressions of her book with a new cover design.
meanings.sent4: The reimpressions of the magazine sold out quickly due to the exclusive content.
meanings.sent5: The student eagerly purchased the reimpressions of the textbook to get the updated information.
